Title: The Rise and Fall of Charles Lindbergh
Description: This biography of the explores the famed aviator's childhood, flying career, and eventual attraction to eugenics and Nazism.
Author: Candace Fleming

Title: 5th Grade Math Vocabulary
Description: Explore a comprehensive collection of essential math vocabulary tailored for 5th grade students. With this vocabulary in their arsenal, students will be able to confidently tackle math problems related to numbers and operations, geometry, measurement, and data and finance.

Title: Camp Panda
Subtitle: Helping Cubs Return to the Wild
Description: This nonfiction work explains the efforts taken by China and the United States to successfully preserve the giant panda from extinction.
Author: Catherine Thimmesh

Title: An American Plague
Subtitle: The True and Terrifying Story of the Yellow Fever Epidemic of 1793
Description: Drawing on medical research, news articles, and firsthand accounts, Jim Murphy traces the yellow fever epidemic of 1793 in this gripping historical account.
Author: Jim Murphy

Title: Fallout
Subtitle: Spies, Superbombs, and the Ultimate Cold War Showdown
Description: In this follow-up to Bomb, the award-winning author shows how the development of the atomic bomb led to tensions between the United States and the Soviet Union that threatened massive destruction for nearly fifty years after World War II.
Author: Steve Sheinkin

Title: The Bean Trees
Description: Kingsolver's first novel tells the story of Taylor Greer, who leaves Kentucky and tries to make a life for herself and an orphaned Native American girl in Tucson, Arizona.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Title: The Last of the Mohicans
Subtitle: A Narrative of 1757
Description: During the French and Indian War, a British colonist's daughters, their Native American guides, and a scout named Hawkeye attempt a dangerous journey from Fort Edward to Fort Henry.
Author: James Fenimore Cooper

Title: The Way Back
Description: In this historical fantasy novel, Bluma and Yehuda Leib cross over into the land of the dead.
Author: Gavriel Savit

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: February 2022
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Simon vs. the Homo Sapiens Agenda
Description: In this funny and heartwarming novel, sixteen-year-old Simon Spier finds himself in the middle of a real-life drama when a classmate threatens to expose his secrets. Learn these words from Becky Albertalli's award-winning debut.
Author: Becky Albertalli

Title: Red, White & Royal Blue
Description: First Son Alex Claremont-Diaz is working to ensure his mother's reelection; but when he falls for his old rival, the Prince of Wales, they unintentionally spark an international incident.
Author: Casey McQuiston

Title: The View from Saturday
Description: In this novel, the members of Mrs. Olinski's champion Academic Bowl team reveal the secrets behind their unexpected success.
Author: E.L. Konigsburg

Title: Aviva vs. the Dybbuk
Description: First appearing after her father's death, the dybbuk is a spirit that eleven-year-old Aviva Jacobs believes is causing trouble within her Jewish neighborhood.
Author: Mari Lowe

Title: Because They Marched
Subtitle: The People's Campaign for Voting Rights that Changed America
Description: This nonfiction account of the 1965 voting rights march from Selma to Montgomery is richly illustrated with archival photographs.
Author: Russell Freedman

Title: Elephant Run
Description: Forced to work as a servant in a Burmese village during World War II, Nick plans a daring escape.
Author: Roland Smith

Title: Uglies
Description: In a dystopian society that values beauty above all else, Tally Youngblood faces a choice: undergo cosmetic surgery to become a "pretty" or join a group of rebels.
Author: Scott Westerfeld

Title: Orlando: A Biography
Description: Born an English nobleman, Orlando serves King Charles II as an ambassador to Constantinople, where he wakes up one day as a woman and lives on for several centuries switching between genders.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Title: Monday's Not Coming
Description: When Claudia's best friend disappears, Claudia is determined to find out what happened to her.
Author: Tiffany D. Jackson

Title: Freewater
Description: Running away from the slave-owning Southerland Plantation, twelve-year-old Homer and his seven-year-old sister Ada head to the swamp, where they find some unexpected help.
Author: Amina Luqman-Dawson

Title: The Unteachables
Description: An apathetic teacher is assigned to a class of unruly misfits — with surprising results.
Author: Gordon Korman

Title: The Selected Fairy Tales of Hans Christian Andersen
Description: Hans Christian Andersen was born in Denmark in 1805. He is celebrated for his timeless fairy tales that have enchanted generations worldwide. From "The Little Mermaid" to "The Ugly Duckling," his stories explore themes of love, transformation, and the human condition, leaving a lasting legacy in children's literature and inspiring countless adaptations in various forms of media. Andersen's enduring tales continue to captivate readers of all ages with their magical charm and universal appeal.

Title: World Without Fish
Description: In this book, Mark Kurlansky explores threats to the world's oceans and fish populations and describes ways that young people can support sustainable fishing.
Author: Mark Kurlansky

Title: Resistance
Description: A Jewish teenager joins the resistance movement against the Nazis during World War II.
Author: Jennifer A. Nielsen

Title: The God of Small Things
Description: The traumatic separation of fraternal twins in India is at the heart of Arundhati Roy's "God of a Small Things" which addresses communism and the Indian caste system while recounting the lives of the twins both together and apart.
Author: Arundhati Roy

Title: Positive and Negative Words to Describe a Person
Description: If you're looking for the perfect adjective to describe your dearest friend, your worst enemy, or characters in a piece of creative writing, look no further than this collection of vivid vocabulary to describe people.

Title: Hidden Truths
Description: On a summer camping trip in Massachusetts, twelve-year-old best friends Eric Stein and Dani Meyer are shaken up by a fiery explosion.
Author: Elly Swartz

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: September, 2019
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Words Used in the News
Description: News you can use! Each week we peruse a wide range of periodicals and select newsworthy words from a variety of topics — politics to pop culture, science to sports, and more. These annotated lists also provide additional context about current events and etymological tidbits, making them a great resource for word learning and class discussions.

Title: The Ice Cream Machine
Description: In this collection, all six stories feature an ice cream machine with different characters and situations, from a five-armed robot to an alien space lab.
Author: Adam Rubin

Title: Mary Poppins
Description: In this beloved novel, a magical nanny arrives at the Banks's home to care for two children, Jane and Michael.
Author: P. L. Travers

Title: Projekt 1065
Subtitle: A Novel of World War II
Description: During World War II, thirteen-year-old Michael and his family infiltrate Nazi organizations to help the Allies defeat Hitler.
Author: Alan Gratz

Title: I, Juan de Pareja
Description: This novel is a fictionalized account of the life of Juan de Pareja, the half-African slave of famed painter Diego Velázquez in 17th century Spain.
Author: Elizabeth Borton de Treviño

Title: Second Treatise of Government
Description: In this 17th-century treatise, Locke argues that governments are only legitimate when leaders rule with the consent of those who are governed. Read the full text here.
Author: John Locke

Title: The Storm Runner
Description: Zane discovers that a dormant volcano is a portal to another dimension where he must battle an ancient god.
Author: J.C. Cervantes

Title: Billy Budd
Description: Published after Melville's death, this novel chronicles the tragic story of young sailor Billy Budd after he boards a naval warship, the H.M.S. Bellipotent. Read the full text here.
Author: Herman Melville

Title: More Than a Dream
Subtitle: The Radical March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom
Description: In this nonfiction account, the authors present their research on the causes and contributions that led to the historic 1963 March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom.
Author: Yohuru Williams

Title: The Marvels
Description: Two separate stories — the first told in illustrations and the second in prose — combine to create a marvelous whole in this book from the Caldecott-winning author of The Invention of Hugo Cabret.
Author: Brian Selznick

Title: Through My Eyes
Description: In this memoir, Ruby Bridges recalls her experiences as the first African-American student at a newly desegregated elementary school in New Orleans.
Author: Ruby Bridges

Title: The Eyes and the Impossible
Description: Johannes is a dog who runs freely through the park each day and reports to the Bison any sightings that might upset the natural balance.
Author: Dave Eggers

Title: Simon Sort of Says
Description: Twelve-year-old Simon O'Keeffe tries to forget that he survived a tragedy when his family moves to the National Quiet Zone in Nebraska, where radio signals are banned to prevent interference with astronomers' search of outer space.
Author: Erin Bow

Title: Freak the Mighty
Description: Freak the Mighty tells the story of an unlikely friendship between an awkward, lumbering outcast and a physically challenged genius. Together, the two boys become a force for good.
Author: Rodman Philbrick

Title: Frightful's Mountain
Description: In the third book of the My Side of the Mountain trilogy, Frightful is on her own in the wilderness, trying to survive without Sam.
Author: Jean Craighead George

Title: Time for Andrew: A Ghost Story
Description: Named after a long line of men in his family, twelve-year-old Andrew Joseph Tyler visits his ancestral home in Missouri and gets transported back in time.
Author: Mary Downing Hahn

Title: The Selected Fairy Tales of the Brothers Grimm
Description: The Brothers Grimm, Jacob and Wilhelm Grimm, were renowned German scholars and folklorists who compiled and published a collection of traditional European folktales and fairy tales in the early 19th century. Their stories have had a profound and lasting impact on literature and popular culture, offering readers a rich tapestry of enchanting stories filled with moral lessons and timeless magic.

Title: The Hobbit
Description: In this prequel to The Lord of the Rings, Bilbo Baggins enjoys a quiet life until a group of dwarves and a wizard named Gandalf enlist him in their quest for a dragon's treasure.
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: November 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: The Young Man and the Sea
Description: Twelve-year-old Skiff attempts to catch a valuable bluefin tuna in order to support his struggling family.
Author: Rodman Philbrick

Title: I Survived the American Revolution, 1776
Description: In this fifteenth book of the historical fiction I Survived series, eleven-year-old Nathaniel Fox runs away from home and finds himself in the middle of the Battle of Brooklyn.
Author: Lauren Tarshis

Title: Elijah of Buxton
Description: Born in a Canadian settlement for runaway slaves, naive and well-meaning Elijah is forced to confront the realities of slavery when he attempts to recover stolen money that would help free a friend's enslaved family.
Author: Christopher Paul Curtis

Title: The Lottery Rose
Description: When almost-eight-year-old Georgie Burgess wins a rosebush from a Florida grocery store, he seeks to give it the tender-loving home that he has never known.
Author: Irene Hunt

Title: Letter of the Law
Subtitle: The Legal Lexicon of U.S. Supreme Court Decisions
Description: The U.S. Supreme Court has the power to shape history. Our collection of Supreme Court decisions will help students understand and master the vocabulary used to decide pivotal cases.

Title: Trowbridge Road
Description: In 1983, neighbors June Bug and Ziggy create their own imaginative worlds in order to escape from the realities of family trauma.
Author: Marcella Pixley

Title: The Tempest
Description: After a shipwreck, a group of noblemen wash up on an enchanted island ruled by the magician Prospero. Read the full text here.
Author: William Shakespeare

Title: Flunked
Subtitle: Fairy Tale Reform School, Book 1
Description: After she gets caught stealing, Gilly Cobbler is sent to a boarding school run by (supposedly) reformed fairy tale villains.
Author: Jen Calonita

Title: Barefoot Dreams of Petra Luna
Description: Based on a true story, this historical novel follows twelve-year-old Petra and her family as they flee their home during the Mexican Revolution and travel through battlefields and deserts to find a better life in the United States.
Author: Alda P. Dobbs

Title: The Book Thief
Description: Liesel Meminger is a foster child living in Nazi Germany in 1939. Surrounded by violence, hardship, and war, Liesel is watched over by Death, who narrates her story.
Author: Markus Zusak

Title: Dragons in a Bag
Description: Jaxon and his friends Vikram and Kavita are unexpectedly tasked with delivering a bag of baby dragons to a magical land.
Author: Zetta Elliott

Title: Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass
Description: Written by the influential abolitionist, Douglass's autobiography bears witness to the horrors of slavery. Read the full text here.
Author: Frederick Douglass

Title: Eagle Drums
Description: While walking toward the mountains to gather obsidian, young Piŋa is chosen by the eagles to learn their ways of telling stories through music and dance so that he could unite the Iñupiaq people of the Arctic tundra.
Author: Nasuġraq Rainey Hopson

Title: RBG's Brave & Brilliant Women
Subtitle: 33 Jewish Women to Inspire Everyone
Description: In collaboration with Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, the author compiled brief biographies of thirty-three Jewish women, from biblical times to the 20th-century, who overcame obstacles to change the world in inspiring ways.
Author: Nadine Epstein

Title: Disaster Area
Subtitle: Be Prepared with Words for Catastrophes and Calamities
Description: Equip yourself for all manner of disasters, natural or otherwise, with this collection of lists related to unexpected events that cause considerable upheaval. In uncertain times, you might just have the last word!

Title: Howl's Moving Castle
Description: In this fantasy novel, Sophie must go on a quest to find a wizard in order to break a spell that has been cast on her.
Author: Diana Wynne Jones

Title: Listen, Slowly
Description: Twelve-year-old Mai travels to Vietnam to find her grandfather and learn about her heritage.
Author: Thanhha Lai

Title: The GRE Verbal Reasoning Test: Warm-up Words
Description: During the Verbal Reasoning section of the GRE, you'll encounter a variety of words. Our collection of warm-up words features words commonly found on assessments. You may already be familiar with some of these words. Brush up on them first to make sure that you have a solid foundation for the GRE.

Title: The Greatest: Muhammad Ali
Description: This biography of Muhammad Ali explores the boxer's career and his activism.
Author: Walter Dean Myers

Title: Breaking Through
Description: In this memoir, Francisco Jiménez details his family's experiences as Mexican immigrants in the United states during the 1950s and 1960s.
Author: Francisco Jiménez

Title: Lucky Broken Girl
Description: Recent immigrants from Cuba, Ruthie and her family are just learning to adjust to life in New York City when Ruthie is severely injured in a car accident. This novel, based in part on the author's childhood experiences, won the 2018 Pura Belpré Award.
Author: Ruth Behar

Title: Travels with Charley
Subtitle: in Search of America
Description: In this traveogue, acclaimed author John Steinbeck sets out on a roadtrip across America with his best friend, a French poodle named Charley.
Author: John Steinbeck

Title: On the Far Side of the Mountain
Description: In this sequel to My Side of the Mountain, Sam Gribley's sister Alice joins her brother in the Catskill Mountains. But when Alice disappears and Sam's beloved falcon is taken away, he must fight to get them back.
Author: Jean Craighead George

Title: Song for a Whale
Description: Iris is a 12-year-old girl who is deaf; when she learns about Blue 55, a whale that sings at a frequency other whales can't understand, she vows to find a way to communicate with him.
Author: Lynne Kelly

Title: Wish
Description: Every day, Charlie Reese wishes that her fractured family will reunite — but when she is sent to live with her aunt and uncle, she must reconsider what she really wants and needs.
Author: Barbara O'Connor

Title: Interpreter of Maladies
Description: The title story of Jhumpa Lahiri's collection explores the way people try, and fail, to communicate with one another.
Author: Jhumpa Lahiri

Title: Amelia Lost
Subtitle: The Life and Disappearance of Amelia Earhart
Description: This biography explores the life and mysterious disappearance of aviator Amelia Earhart.
Author: Candace Fleming

Title: Escape from Camp 14
Subtitle: One Man's Remarkable Odyssey from North Korea to Freedom in the West
Description: Journalist Blaine Harden recounts the life of Shin Dong-hyuk, a young man who made a daring escape from a North Korean prison camp.
Author: Blaine Harden

Title: All Boys Aren't Blue
Subtitle: A Memoir-Manifesto
Description: In this unflinching memoir, George M. Johnson interweaves personal history with reflections on systemic oppression.
Author: George M. Johnson

Title: Land of the Cranes
Description: Imprisoned in a detention camp, Betita dreams of reuniting her family.
Author: Aida Salazar

Title: The Beloved World of Sonia Sotomayor
Description: In this memoir, Sonia Sotomayor recounts her childhood in the South Bronx, her education and early work as a lawyer, and her eventual appointment to the Supreme Court of the United States.
Author: Sonia Sotomayor

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: November 2022
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: How the Other Half Lives
Subtitle: Studies Among the Tenements of New York
Description: This pioneering work of photojournalism documents the gulf between life in the rich neighborhoods and poor slums of New York City in the 1880s.
Author: Jacob Riis

Title: After Tupac and D Foster
Description: In 1995, a new arrival to their New York City neighborhood changes the lives of Neeka and her best friend.
Author: Jacqueline Woodson

Title: Reality Check
Subtitle: Words for What’s True and What’s False
Description: Separate fact from fiction with this collection of words that covers the spectrum from truth to lies and everything in between.

Title: Red Queen
Description: In Mare's world, people are divided by the color of their blood. When red-blooded Mare displays magical abilities belonging to those outside her caste, she is welcomed into the circles of the silver-blooded elites — but where do her loyalties truly lie?
Author: Victoria Aveyard

Title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Description: Loosely based on the author, the narrator sets out to write a book about his experiences during World War II, but ends up telling about Billy Pilgrim, a soldier who gets "unstuck in time" and travels throughout moments of his life both on Earth and the planet Tralfamadore.
Author: Kurt Vonnegut

Title: Ambushed!
Subtitle: The Assassination Plot Against President Garfield
Description: In this nonfiction book, Gail Jarrow chronicles the life of James Garfield, detailing Garfield's early life, his rise to become the 20th president of the United States, and the events and aftermath of his assassination.
Author: Gail Jarrow

Title: Elements of the Universe
Subtitle: Explore the Cosmos with These Word Roots
Description: Want to fire up your vocabulary? The sky’s the limit with our lists of elemental word roots. Master a universe of words related to earth, air, fire, water, and sky.

Title: The Princess Bride
Subtitle: S. Morgenstern's Classic Tale of True Love and High Adventure
Description: William Goldman's beloved fairy tale features a princess, a pirate, and a villainous prince. Do you think these words from the novel will stump you? Inconceivable!
Author: William Goldman

Title: Bull Run
Description: In this historical fiction, sixteen characters describe their actions and reactions connected to the first major battle of the Civil War, which was fought on July 21, 1861 in Virginia.
Author: Paul Fleischman

Title: Dry
Description: When their parents disappear during a crippling drought, siblings Alyssa and Garrett join a small group of teens in a desperate quest for survival.
Author: Neal Shusterman

Title: Sideways Stories from Wayside School
Description: This collection of wacky tales explores the lives of the zany students and teachers at Wayside School.
Author: Louis Sachar

Title: Ice Magic
Description: When middle schooler Pie Pennelli is told by the Byrd twins that his recent hockey game had exactly the same moves and score as the one they'd played on a toy the night before, he is unsure what to think about this possible magic.
Author: Matt Christopher

Title: Synonyms
Description: Don't try to use a thesaurus to find a synonym for useless. The results will be futile. Instead, look through this collection of synonyms. It's more or less the same thing.

Title: Sold
Description: Lakshmi's stepfather tells her she must leave their impoverished Nepalese village and work in the city — but when Lakshmi arrives, she discovers that she is a victim of trafficking.
Author: Patricia McCormick

Title: Brave
Description: This sequel to Awkward follows Berrybrook Middle School student Jensen Graham as he attempts to fit in at school and stand up to bullies.
Author: Svetlana Chmakova

Title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
Description: When Charlie Bucket and four other children find golden tickets in their chocolate bars, they are invited to tour Willy Wonka's famous candy factory.
Author: Roald Dahl

Title: Ninth Ward
Description: Twelve-year-old Lanesha and her caretaker, both endowed with supernatural gifts, must fight to survive when Hurricane Katrina hits New Orleans.
Author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

Title: The Fire Next Time
Description: In this classic essay, James Baldwin reflects on his youthful experiences and probes America's history of racial injustice.
Author: James Baldwin

Title: Before We Were Free
Description: Twelve-year-old Anita has grown up in the Dominican Republic during the brutal Trujillo regime. When her family gets caught up in an attempt to overthrow the dictator, Anita must find her own path to freedom.
Author: Julia Alvarez

Title: I Can Make This Promise
Description: A twelve-year-old girl searches for the truth about her family's Native American heritage.
Author: Christine Day

Title: The Black Cauldron
Subtitle: The Chronicles of Prydain, Book 2
Description: In the second book in the Chronicles of Prydain series, Taran continues his quest to destroy the Black Cauldron that can bring the dead back to life.
Author: Lloyd Alexander

Title: Jacob Have I Loved
Description: Growing up on a remote fishing island in the 1940s, Sara Louise attempts to escape the shadow of her talented and favored twin sister.
Author: Katherine Paterson

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: July 2023
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Finding Junie Kim
Description: When Junie interviews her grandparents about their experiences during the Korean War, she is inspired to take a stand against racism at her middle school.
Author: Ellen Oh

Title: Be Real, Macy Weaver
Description: In both South Carolina and Maryland, eleven-year-old Macy, desperate for a best friend, weaves a web of lies that she hopes would be impressive.
Author: Lakita Wilson

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: October 2021
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: The Boy Who Harnessed the Wind
Subtitle: Creating Currents of Electricity and Hope
Description: This memoir describes how Kamkwamba, who grew up in a small Malawian village, built a windmill to bring electricity to his family's home.
Author: William Kamkwamba

Title: Wuthering Heights
Description: Catherine Earnshaw's father takes in an orphan boy named Heathcliff, setting in motion a chain of events that will haunt the Earnshaw family for generations.
Author: Emily Brontë

Title: There’s Something about Sweetie
Description: In this companion novel to When Dimple Met Rishi, Ashish Patel allows his parents to set him up on a series of dates with Sweetie Nair, an athlete who wants to prove to her traditional mother that she can be happy at any size.
Author: Sandhya Menon

Title: Killers of the Flower Moon
Subtitle: The Osage Murders and the Birth of the FBI
Description: In this true crime book, David Grann investigates the murders of members of Osage Nation in the 1920s.
Author: David Grann

Title: Keep It Together, Keiko Carter
Description: Keiko has always counted on her best friends, Audrey and Jenna — but the girls' friendship is tested as they navigate seventh grade.
Author: Debbi Michiko Florence

Title: Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe
Description: Aristotle and Dante are two teenagers with classical names and loner attitudes. When their paths cross, they develop a friendship that will change their lives.
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

Title: Calculus
Description: Make math class exponentially easier by reviewing these lists of terms that are integral to Calculus. You'll learn about differentiation, derivatives, limits, functions, series, and more.

Title: Homewords Bound
Subtitle: Make Yourself at Home with This Collection of Architecture and Interiors Vocabulary
Description: If you're spending a lot of time at home these days, you might as well learn the words for everything associated with the structures, ideas, decorations, and designs behind the buildings where we live, learn, and work. Come on in!

Title: I Am Alfonso Jones
Description: This powerful graphic novel, illustrated by Stacey Robinson and John Jennings, explores the life and afterlife of a teenager who is a victim of gun violence.
Author: Tony Medina

Title: A Doll's House
Description: Nora Helmer appears to be a happy wife and mother — but when someone from her past threatens to reveal a devastating secret, Nora must reevaluate the assumptions she made about her marriage. Read the full text here.
Author: Henrik Ibsen

Title: Pollyanna
Description: A classic of children's literature, this book tells the story of an orphan with a persistent, infectious sense of optimism. Read the full text here.
Author: Eleanor H. Porter

Title: All Creatures Great and Small
Subtitle: Discover the Wild World of Animal Words
Description: Whether you’re a dog person, a cat person, or even an elephant person, there’s a gaggle of wonderful words to explore in this menagerie of animal-related lists. Take a vocabulary safari and learn the lion’s share of these terms.

Title: The Journey of Little Charlie
Description: In order to repay a debt, twelve-year-old Charlie agrees to help the cruel Cap'n Buck to capture several fugitive slaves. But when Charlie is confronted with the horrors of slavery, he is forced to reconsider his plans.
Author: Christopher Paul Curtis

Title: Dactyl Hill Squad
Description: In this historical fantasy novel set during the Civil War, orphan Magdalys Roca attempts to rescue her friends from a slave trader — with the help of some domesticated dinosaurs.
Author: Daniel José Older

Title: The Glass Menagerie
Description: Amanda Wingfield clings to her memories of her youth while living with her two children, Laura and Tom. When Tom brings a friend home for dinner, the family's precarious balance is disrupted.
Author: Tennessee Williams

Title: A Monster Calls
Description: As Conor struggles to deal with his mother's terminal illness, he encounters a monster who demands that Conor tell him a truthful story.
Author: Patrick Ness

Title: Flying Lessons & Other Stories
Description: This collection, edited by We Need Diverse Books founder Ellen Oh, features short stories by popular writers of middle grade and young adult fiction.
Author: Ellen Oh

Title: Talk Like Shakespeare Day
Description: Anon, vocabulary lovers! April 23 is Talk Like Shakespeare Day. To honor the good Bard of Avon, we've put together this collection of common words that Shakespeare is credited with putting into print for the first time. No legacy is so rich as new vocabulary.

Title: Ben and Me
Subtitle: An Astonishing Life of Benjamin Franklin by His Good Mouse Amos
Description: In this work of historical fiction, a mouse named Amos helps Benjamin Franklin create some of his famous inventions.
Author: Robert Lawson

Title: Efrén Divided
Description: When his mother is deported, twelve-year-old Efrén must take on new responsibilities, including caring for his younger siblings.
Author: Ernesto Cisneros

Title: Americanized
Subtitle: Rebel Without a Green Card
Description: In this memoir, Sara Saedi describes her shocking discovery as a young teen that she was an undocumented immigrant and her journey to getting a green card.
Author: Sara Saedi

Title: Crenshaw
Description: As his family struggles financially, Jackson deals with hardship with the help of his imaginary friend, a giant cat named Crenshaw.
Author: Katherine Applegate

Title: The Odyssey
Description: In this epic poem, clever Odysseus attempts to find his way home after the end of the Trojan War. Learn these words from the translation by Robert Fagles.
Author: Homer

Title: All Quiet on the Western Front
Description: Translated by A.W. Wheen, Remarque's masterpiece details the experiences of German soldiers during World War I.
Author: Erich Maria Remarque

Title: Wings of Ebony
Description: After the death of her mother, seventeen-year-old Rue is forced to leave her younger sister and go with her estranged father to Ghizon, a hidden island full of magical beings. There, Rue learns the truth of her ancestry and why she must go back to save her sister before it's too late.
Author: J. Elle

Title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
Description: In his sixth year at Hogwarts, Harry learns more about Voldemort's past and discovers a mysterious Potions textbook.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Title: The Bridge Home
Description: After running away from home, Viji and her sister Rukku join up with a group of orphans struggling to survive in the city of Chennai, India.
Author: Padma Venkatraman

Title: Sense and Sensibility
Description: In this comedy of manners — Jane Austen's first — Elinor and Marianne Dashwood struggle to make their way in the world after their father's death leaves them impoverished. Read the full text here.
Author: Jane Austen

Title: Not Here to Be Liked
Description: When eleventh-grader Eliza Quan loses the election for editor in chief to a less qualified male candidate, she starts a protest at her California high school.
Author: Michelle Quach

Title: Aru Shah and the End of Time
Description: When 12-year-old Aru Shah lights a cursed lamp in the Museum of Ancient Indian Art and Culture, she releases an ancient demon. Now she must find a way to stop the demon and rescue her friends and family.
Author: Roshani Chokshi

Title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
Description: Considered a seminal work of African-American literature, Their Eyes Were Watching God is notable for its strong and independent female protagonist.
Author: Zora Neale Hurston

Title: The War to End All Wars
Subtitle: World War I
Description: This historical account shows how the Great War (1914–1918) that involved two dozen countries and killed about twenty million people marked the beginning of conflicts with weapons capable of mass destruction.
Author: Russell Freedman

Title: The Last Fallen Star
Description: After a magic spell goes awry, Riley must try to find a fallen star in order to save her sister's life.
Author: Graci Kim

Title: I Am the Messenger
Description: Ed Kennedy lives an ordinary life — but when he stops a robbery, he gets swept up in an extraordinary mission.
Author: Markus Zusak

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: October 2022
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Echo
Description: The lives of three children become intertwined when they encounter a musical instrument with a mysterious history.
Author: Pam Muñoz Ryan

Title: The Inexplicable Logic of My Life
Description: Sal has always felt at home with his adoptive father, his beloved grandmother, and his best friend, Samantha. But as his senior year progresses, Sal struggles with volatile anger, unexpected tragedy, and changing relationships with friends and family.
Author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

Title: City of Orphans
Description: Maks, a newsboy living in New York City in the late 19th century, tries to prove his sister's innocence after she is accused of theft.
Author: Avi

Title: Liar & Spy
Description: When Georges moves to a new apartment building, he meets Safer, who enlists Georges in a scheme to spy on a mysterious neighbor. Learn these words from the novel by Rebecca Stead.
Author: Rebecca Stead

Title: Restart
Description: After an accident leaves him with amnesia, Chase must figure out who he was — and who he wants to be.
Author: Gordon Korman

Title: Grab Bag for Word Nerds, Part Two
Subtitle: A(nother) Lexicon for Literati, Logophiles, and Sesquipedalianists
Description: This collection celebrates words about words in a number of forms. From the science of written and spoken language to terms for slang to confusing words made from common ones, this plenitude of parlance will satisfy the most voracious verbivore. Check out Grab Bag for Word Nerds: Part One.

Title: Breadcrumbs
Description: In this modernized fairy tale, Hazel must journey into an icy forest to rescue her best friend Jack from a snow queen.
Author: Anne Ursu

Title: One for the Murphys
Description: After being placed with a foster family, 12-year-old Carley struggles to figure out where she belongs.
Author: Lynda Mullaly Hunt

Title: Slay
Description: No one knows that seventeen-year-old Kiera Johnson is the developer behind a popular online role-playing game called SLAY. But when the game is linked to an act of violence in the real world, growing controversy puts both Kiera and her game at risk.
Author: Brittney Morris

Title: The Namesake
Description: Born to Indian immigrants and legally named after a Russian writer, but familiarly called Nikhil, Gogol Ganguli grows up in Massachusetts struggling with his parents' choices and expectations.
Author: Jhumpa Lahiri

Title: The Omnivore's Dilemma
Description: Adapted for young readers, this important work is an investigation into the ways food production is shaped by politics and the effects of our food choices.
Author: Michael Pollan

Title: Clap When You Land
Description: After their father dies in a plane crash, two sisters who never met must come to terms with each other's existence.
Author: Elizabeth Acevedo

Title: Instructions for Dancing
Description: When her parents' seemingly happy marriage breaks up, high school senior Yvette (Evie) Antoinette Thomas decides she doesn't believe in love anymore, until she starts taking ballroom dancing lessons in preparation for a Los Angeles competition.
Author: Nicola Yoon

Title: The Duchess of Malfi
Description: Money, power, and love destroy a noble family in this semi-historical tragedy by John Webster. Learn these words that first shook The Globe Theater in 1614. Read the full text here.
Author: John Webster

Title: If I Stay
Description: Seventeen ­year-old Mia has an out-of-body experience—and faces a heartbreaking choice—after a devastating car accident.
Author: Gayle Forman

Title: Fences
Description: Set against the backdrop of the Civil Rights Movement, this Pulitzer Prize-winning play follows former baseball player Troy Maxson as he tries to find his place in the world and navigate troubled relationships with his wife and son.
Author: August Wilson

Title: More to the Story
Description: Jameela is excited to work on the staff of her school newspaper, but she must deal with a tough editor-in-chief, the prolonged absence of her father, and her sister's serious illness.
Author: Hena Khan

Title: The Midwife's Apprentice
Description: In medieval England, an orphaned girl named Brat becomes an apprentice to Jane Sharp, the local midwife.
Author: Karen Cushman

Title: The Blackbird Girls
Description: In this work of historical fiction, two Soviet girls are sent to a new home after the Chernobyl disaster.
Author: Anne Blankman

Title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
Description: Good-hearted but mischievous, Tom Sawyer can't keep himself out of trouble as he grows up in a small town on the Mississippi River. Read the full text here.
Author: Mark Twain

Title: Wolf Hollow
Description: During World War II, a 12-year-old girl named Annabelle befriends a reclusive veteran and contends with a vicious bully.
Author: Lauren Wolk

Title: Insignificant Events in the Life of a Cactus
Description: When her parents take jobs at a western theme park in Arizona, Aven gets caught up in a local mystery — and tries to adjust to a new school.
Author: Dusti Bowling

Title: The Queen's Gambit
Description: A young girl experiences triumph and despair as she becomes immersed in the world of competitive chess.
Author: Walter Tevis

Title: The Blood Years
Description: As a Jewish teenager in German-occupied Romania during World War II, Frederieke Teitler struggles with the sacrifices she makes in order to survive.
Author: Elana K. Arnold

Title: Spies
Subtitle: The Secret Showdown Between America and Russia
Description: In this riveting nonfiction account, Marc Favreau explores the role of espionage in the Cold War.
Author: Marc Favreau

Title: A Thousand Steps into Night
Description: After receiving a curse that causes her to slowly transform into a demon with a deadly touch, Miuko embarks on a quest to find a cure so that she can return to her normal life.
Author: Traci Chee

Title: Milkweed
Description: "Stop! Thief!" are the words often shouted at him, so a young orphan takes that as his name as he struggles to survive in Warsaw during World War II.
Author: Jerry Spinelli

Title: The Last Lecture
Description: After being diagnosed with terminal cancer, professor Randy Pausch wrote this inspirational book about achieving one's dreams.
Author: Randy Pausch

Title: Troublemaker
Description: When riots break out in Los Angeles, sixth-grader Jordan Park decides he must go to his family's store to protect his father.
Author: John Cho

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: March 2022
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: A Step from Heaven
Description: Young Ju immigrates to the United States from Korea, but she struggles to fit in to her new culture and to cope with her increasingly fractured family.
Author: An Na

Title: Somewhere Between Bitter and Sweet
Description: Teenagers Penelope and Xander navigate first love and family matters while working at Penelope's father's restaurant.
Author: Laekan Zea Kemp

Title: Front Desk
Description: Ten-year-old Mia Tang lives and works at the motel where her immigrant parents are employed. Together, Mia and her family strive to make a better life for themselves — and for other immigrants in their community.
Author: Kelly Yang

Title: Not So Pure and Simple
Description: Del Rainey joins a church group in order to get close to his crush, Kiera Westing.
Author: Lamar Giles

Title: Astronauts
Subtitle: Women on the Final Frontier
Description: Using a graphic novel format, the authors of Primates tell the stories of the first women in space, focusing on astronaut Mary Cleave.
Author: Jim Ottaviani

Title: Sisters
Description: In this graphic memoir, Raina Telgemeier recounts a childhood road trip to Colorado and explores her relationship with her sister Amara.
Author: Raina Telgemeier

Title: The Poisonwood Bible
Description: Spanning three decades, this novel tells the story of the Prices, a missionary family that settles in the Belgian Congo in the late 1950s.
Author: Barbara Kingsolver

Title: Some Places More Than Others
Description: Eleven-year-old Amara visits Harlem with her father to learn more about her family's history.
Author: Renée Watson

Title: Twilight
Description: Bella Swan moves to Forks, Washington, where she meets the enigmatic Edward Cullen, a classmate with a dark secret.
Author: Stephenie Meyer

Title: The One and Only Ivan
Description: Inspired by true events, this award-winning novel by Katherine Applegate tells the story of a captive gorilla and the elephant he befriends.
Author: Katherine Applegate

Title: In the Shadow of Liberty
Description: This historical narrative shines a spotlight on the little-known details of how America's freedoms were shaped by four presidents who relied heavily on their slaves.
Author: Kenneth C. Davis

Title: Ella Enchanted
Description: In this reimagining of the Cinderella story, Ella tries to escape a curse that prevents her from disobeying orders.
Author: Gail Carson Levine

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: April 2023
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Posted
Description: Students at Branton Middle School begin communicating with each other by means of sticky notes — but soon, kids are using words as weapons.
Author: John David Anderson

Title: Leah on the Offbeat
Description: In this sequel to Simon vs. the Homo-Sapiens Agenda, Leah Burke navigates difficulties during her senior year: her mom's new relationship, college admissions, tensions among her friends, and a painful crush.
Author: Becky Albertalli

Title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
Description: Alice falls asleep in a meadow and wakes in a surreal world inhabited by characters such as the White Rabbit, the Red Queen, and the Cheshire Cat. Learn these words from Lewis Carroll's delightful and witty novel.
Author: Lewis Carroll

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: December 2020
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Snow Falling on Cedars
Description: In the shadow of World War II, a Japanese-American man is accused of murdering a fisherman, exposing long-buried secrets, animosity, and prejudice in the island community of San Piedro.
Author: David Guterson

Title: AP English Language and Composition Exam
Description: Ensure you're prepared for the AP English Language and Composition Exam by learning the words in this collection of essential vocabulary. Our lists cover the language you'll see in test questions and writing prompts, important rhetorical and literary terminology, and vocabulary related to writing and grammar.

Title: The Pinballs
Description: Three children strike up a friendship as they try to navigate life in foster care.
Author: Betsy Byars

Title: The Incredible Journey
Description: This classic novel tells the story of three pets who go on a quest through the wilderness to reunite with their owner.
Author: Sheila Burnford

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: December 2024
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Tiger, Tiger
Description: This historical novel traces the lives of two tiger cubs in ancient Rome.
Author: Lynne Reid Banks

Title: The Grand Escape
Subtitle: The Greatest Prison Breakout of the 20th Century
Description: This riveting book tells the true story of a group of prisoners of war who escaped from Germany during World War I.
Author: Neal Bascomb

Title: Run: Book One
Description: In this follow-up to the March trilogy, created with Andrew Aydin and Nate Powell, John Lewis recounts the efforts of civil rights activists to register Black voters and support Black candidates for political office.
Author: John Lewis

Title: Walden
Description: In this classic of the transcendentalist movement, Thoreau explains what he learned by living simply and in seclusion near a pond in eastern Massachusetts. Read the full texthere.
Author: Henry David Thoreau

Title: Honey and Me
Description: Having known Hencha “Honey” Wine since they were two years old, Milla Ruth Bloom is surprised when sixth grade and their upcoming bat mitzvahs bring on unexpected challenges to their friendship.
Author: Meira Drazin

Title: Votes for Women!
Description: This book traces the long and difficult fight for women's voting rights in the United States.
Author: Winifred Conkling

Title: Wily Words
Subtitle: Learn the Ins and Outs of These Tricky Terms
Description: Watch out! It’s easy to get tripped up on the tricky words in this collection, which are often mispronounced, misspelled, or mistaken for other terms. Clear up the confusion by practicing these lists.

Title: The Federalist Papers
Description: The essays collectively called The Federalist Papers were written by Alexander Hamilton, James Madison, and John Jay to overcome common objections to the proposed United States Constitution and encourage its ratification. Our lists will ensure you understand essential vocabulary from these foundational works of U.S. government.

Title: In Real Life
Description: Anda loves playing Coarsegold Online, and she discovers that she can make real money by hunting down the "gold farmers" who find valuables in the game and sell them to richer players. When she befriends a gold farmer, however, she learns that his real-life circumstances are much more complicated than she expected.
Author: Cory Doctorow

Title: The Manifestor Prophecy
Subtitle: Nic Blake and the Remarkables, Book 1
Description: In this first book of the Nic Blake and the Remarkables series, twelve-year-old Alexis Nichole Blake is an exile in the Unremarkable world who wants to learn how to use her Gift as a Manifestor, which includes controlling the elements, summoning objects, and creating illusions.
Author: Angie Thomas

Title: Bless Me, Ultima
Description: As he grows up and develops his own sense of identity, Tony is guided by Ultima, a curandera who heals with magic.
Author: Rudolfo Anaya

Title: Secret Coders
Description: In this graphic novel, Hopper and Eni investigate strange creatures and happenings at their school.
Author: Gene Luen Yang

Title: Drums, Girls, and Dangerous Pie
Description: When his little brother is diagnosed with leukemia, Steven's normal teenage life is thrown into chaos.
Author: Jordan Sonnenblick

Title: National Grilled Cheese Day
Description: Celebrate the cheesiest holiday of the year with this carblection of vocabulary that's sure to melt your heart and give your taste buds gooey joy.

Title: The Truth as Told by Mason Buttle
Description: Twelve-year-old Mason Buttle is struggling to cope with learning disabilities, bullies, and the sudden death of his friend Benny. When the investigation into Benny's death casts suspicion on Mason himself, he becomes even more determined to uncover the truth.
Author: Leslie Connor

Title: Katt vs. Dogg
Description: Molly the katt and Oscar the dogg belong to different families who hiss and growl at each other, but when they both get lost in the woods, they must stick together to get back to their camps safely.
Author: James Patterson

Title: Killing Lincoln
Subtitle: The Shocking Assassination that Changed America Forever
Description: This nonfiction account explores the assassination of President Abraham Lincoln and its aftermath.
Author: Bill O'Reilly

Title: Greetings, World Traveler!
Description:
Whether you're going by plane, train, or automobile, make sure to brush up on this collection of travel vocabulary to help you have a trip of a lifetime.

 Share

Title: Towers Falling
Description: In this powerful novel, a Brooklyn fifth grader explores the effects of the September 11th terrorist attacks on her family, friends, city, and country.
Author: Jewell Parker Rhodes

Title: My Fine Fellow
Description: In this twist on the musical My Fair Lady that was inspired by George Bernard Shaw's play Pygmalion, Helena Higgins and Penelope Pickering, students at 19th-century London's Royal Academy of Culinaria Artisticus, disagree on whether transforming street vendor Elijah Little into a gentleman chef is a worthwhile project.
Author: Jennieke Cohen

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: February 2020
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Words Used in the News
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Description: Oscar Wilde scandalized Victorian audiences with this macabre story of a man who trades his soul for eternal youth and beauty. Read the full text here.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Title: Midnight Rider
Description: In colonial Massachusetts, a fourteen-year-old girl joins the fight for American independence.
Author: Joan Hiatt Harlow

Title: Life of Pi
Description: When a violent storm sinks the ship carrying his family from India to North America, Pi is trapped alone in a lifeboat with an orangutan, a hyena, a zebra, and a man-eating tiger named Richard Parker.
Author: Yann Martel

Title: With the Fire on High
Description: Emoni Santiago pursues her dream of becoming a chef while finishing high school and raising her daughter.
Author: Elizabeth Acevedo

Title: Graceling
Subtitle: Graceling Realm, Book 1
Description: Katsa was "graced" with a special power to kill people, but instead of using her power to serve the ill will of her uncle, King Randa, she decides to learn how to use her powers for good.
Author: Kristin Cashore

Title: A Dance with Dragons
Description: In the fifth volume of  A Song of Ice and Fire, the fate of the seven kingdoms of Westeros hangs in the balance after a devastating battle.
Author: George R.R. Martin

Subtitle: The Year That Changed America
Description: This book by award-winning historian Martin W. Sandler focuses on a pivotal year in American history, exploring social and political issues that still resonate today.
Author: Martin W. Sandler

Title: Give Me a Sign
Description: Struggling with hearing loss, seventeen-year-old Lilah gets a job at a summer camp for the deaf and blind to improve her use of American Sign Language.
Author: Anna Sortino

Title: A Deadly Wandering
Subtitle: A Mystery, a Landmark Investigation, and the Astonishing Science of Attention in the Digital Age
Description: Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Matt Richtel explores the profound influence of technology on society in this account of a tragic car accident and its aftermath.
Author: Matt Richtel

Title: 120 Words Every 12th Grader Should Know
Subtitle: Vocabulary You Need to Succeed
Description: By analyzing student data and commonly taught texts, Vocabulary.com has compiled this collection of vocabulary for students in 12th grade. Master these challenging words that you'll come across in literature, articles, and textbooks.

Title: Spin
Description: When a popular DJ is murdered, her friends Kya and Fuse must team up to solve the crime.
Author: Lamar Giles

Title: Zlata’s Diary
Subtitle: A Child's Life in Wartime Sarajevo
Description: In this diary, eleven-year-old Zlata Filipović describes her life in Sarajevo during the Bosnian War.
Author: Zlata Filipović

Title: The Dark Is Rising
Description: Eleven-year-old Will Stanton discovers that he is part of a group of immortals tasked with keeping the world safe from the forces of darkness.
Author: Susan Cooper

Title: Man Made Monsters
Description: In eighteen stories spanning two centuries and territories throughout North America, members of a Cherokee family battle human and supernatural monsters.
Author: Andrea L. Rogers

Title: Charming as Verb
Description: In this romantic comedy, Henri, a Haitian-American teenager who dreams of attending Columbia University, is coerced into helping one of his classmates change her image.
Author: Ben Philippe

Title: Anne of Avonlea
Description: This sequel to Anne of Green Gables focuses on Anne's life as a teacher in Avonlea. Read the full text here.
Author: L.M. Montgomery

Title: Common Sense
Description: In this pamphlet, Paine urges the American colonists to fight for independence from Great Britain and form a new government. Read the full text here.
Author: Thomas Paine

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: November 2024
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: Warrior Girl Unearthed
Description: Also a Firekeeper's Daughter, sixteen-year-old Pearl (Perry) Mary Firekeeper-Birch would rather be fishing on Sugar Island, but as a summer intern, she becomes involved in a database of missing and murdered Indigenous women throughout Michigan.
Author: Angeline Boulley

Title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
Description: In seventeenth-century Holland, Griet's life is changed when she poses for a portrait by the brilliant painter Johannes Vermeer.
Author: Tracy Chevalier

Title: Gathering Blue
Description: In Kira's village, those who are weak or disabled are usually abandoned and left to die. Lame in one leg, Kira is saved only because the village's Council of Elders wishes to exploit her gift for weaving. Learn these words that Lois Lowry uses to weave Kira's story.
Author: Lois Lowry

Title: The New Jim Crow
Subtitle: Mass Incarceration in the Age of Colorblindness
Description: In this award-winning book, civil rights lawyer Michelle Alexander argues that the American criminal justice system unfairly targets and penalizes African Americans, resulting in long-term harm to black communities.
Author: Michelle Alexander

Title: Nimona
Description: In this clever and action-packed graphic novel, an irreverent shapeshifter teams up with a notorious supervillian.
Author: Noelle Stevenson

Title: Sal and Gabi Break the Universe
Description: Sal Vidón is a 13-year-old who is struggling to adjust to a new school — and whose magic tricks can disrupt time and space. When he befriends Gabi Reál and attempts to use his powers to help her sick brother, neither seventh grader is prepared for the consequences.
Author: Carlos Hernandez

Title: A Thousand Sisters
Subtitle: The Heroic Airwomen of the Soviet Union in World War II
Description: This nonfiction work tells the story of how thousands of young Russian women volunteered to be trained as pilots, navigators, and mechanics to defend their country during World War II.
Author: Elizabeth Wein

Title: From the Desk of Zoe Washington
Description: Twelve-year-old Zoe Washington attempts to prove that her father was wrongfully convicted of a crime.
Author: Janae Marks

Title: Blink
Description: Journalist Malcolm Gladwell explores how people process information in order to make snap decisions.
Author: Malcolm Gladwell

Title: This Is My Brain in Love
Description: While working together in central New York to save A-Plus Chinese Garden from bankruptcy, high school sophomores Jocelyn Wu and William Domenici fall in love.
Author: I.W. Gregorio

Title: Among the Hidden
Description: In this dystopian novel, famine and overpopulation has led to a strict Population Law that limits families to two children. Luke, an illegal third child, must spend his life in hiding — but when he meets Jen, another third child, he becomes involved in a dangerous plan to challenge the Population Law.
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix

Title: The Sword of Summer
Subtitle: Magnus Chase and the Gods of Asgard, Book 1
Description: Runaway Magnus Chase discovers he is the son of a Norse god and must prevent the end of the world.
Author: Rick Riordan

Title: Love Radio
Description: As a Detroit DJ spinning hits along with romantic advice, seventeen-year-old Prince Jones challenges Danielle Ford to give him three dates to make her fall in love with him.
Author: Ebony LaDelle

Title: Raymie Nightingale
Description: Raymie enters a local pageant, hoping that the publicity will encourage her absent father to reach out to her. She meets Louisiana and Beverly in a baton-twirling class, and the girls forge a friendship that will help each of them cope with their own losses.
Author: Kate DiCamillo

Title: Zero: The Biography of a Dangerous Idea
Description: Science journalist Charles Seife discusses the history of the number zero, from its origin as an Eastern philosophical concept to its rise as an important tool in mathematics to its current threat to modern physics.
Author: Charles Seife

Title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
Description: In letters addressed to an unnamed friend, Charlie describes his experiences as a high school freshman.
Author: Stephen Chbosky

Title: Oedipus the King
Description: When a plague ravages the city of Thebes, Oedipus hears a prophecy that begins to unravel everything he thought was true. Read the full text here.
Author: Sophocles

Title: The Legend of Auntie Po
Description: In this magical adaptation of the tale of Paul Bunyan, a young Chinese immigrant works at a logging camp in the late 1800s.
Author: Shing Yin Khor

Title: Norse Mythology
Description: In this collection, Neil Gaiman retells Scandinavian myths and legends for a contemporary audience.
Author: Neil Gaiman

Title: Sick Kids in Love
Description: After meeting Sasha in the hospital drip room, sixteen-year-old Isabel considers breaking her no-dating rule and giving love a chance.
Author: Hannah Moskowitz

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: August 2022
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: The Sun Is Also a Star
Description: In this popular novel, two teens meet and fall in love over the course of a single day in New York City.
Author: Nicola Yoon

Title: Where the Watermelons Grow
Description: Twelve-year-old Della struggles to come to terms with her mother's mental illness.
Author: Cindy Baldwin

Title: Death Comes for the Archbishop
Description: Following the Mexican-American War, Bishop Jean Latour and Father Joseph Vaillant work to build a new Roman Catholic dicoese in New Mexico.
Author: Willa Cather

Title: The City Beautiful
Description: Ahead of the 1893 World's Fair in Chicago, Jewish teenage boys begin to disappear from the city's streets. After his best friend goes missing, Alter must race to solve the mystery before he becomes the killer's next victim.
Author: Aden Polydoros

Title: Uprooted
Subtitle: The Japanese American Experience During World War II
Description: In this meticulously researched book, Albert Marrin contextualizes the internment of Japanese Americans during World War II within the broader history of racial prejudice in the United States.
Author: Albert Marrin

Title: The School for Whatnots
Description: Born to very rich parents who can provide a technologically-enhanced education, Maximilian J. Sterling enjoys being at school, until the end of fifth grade, when his best friend suddenly disappears.
Author: Margaret Peterson Haddix

Title: The GED: The Language of the Test
Description: These words are likely to appear in question stems, answer options, and test directions on the GED Test. Master these important terms to ensure you understand the language of the test.

Title: Maus I: My Father Bleeds History
Description: A celebrated classic of the graphic novel form, Maus explores a man's relationship with his Holocaust-survivor father and with history itself.
Author: Art Spiegelman

Title: Hunger of Memory
Description: In this memoir, Richard Rodriguez considers the ways in which his education isolated him from his family, background, and culture.
Author: Richard Rodriguez

Title: Other Words for Home
Description: After she is sent to Cincinnati to escape unrest in Syria, twelve-year-old Jude struggles to adjust to life in the United States.
Author: Jasmine Warga

Title: 5th Grade Human Geography
Description: Review these human geography terms and learn all about the human forces that shape and are shaped by the natural world. You'll explore immigration and emigration, colonialism, development and urbanization, demography, globalization, and much more. Expand the boundaries of your vocabulary with this collection.

Title: Invisible Son
Description: After serving two months in a youth correctional facility for a robbery he didn't commit, high school senior Andre Jackson returns to his Portland, Oregon neighborhood to find that his freedom is further restricted by the COVID-19 pandemic.
Author: Kim Johnson

Title: Most Dangerous
Subtitle: Daniel Ellsberg and the Secret History of the Vietnam War
Description: In this suspenseful and meticulously researched book, Steve Sheinkin brings the Vietnam War era to life by focusing on Daniel Ellsberg, a military analyst who initially helped justify the Vietnam War and later released top-secret documents known as the Pentagon Papers.
Author: Steve Sheinkin

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Description: After being falsely imprisoned, Edmond Dantès escapes, disguises himself as the Count of Monte Cristo, and seeks revenge. Learn these words from the 1888 translation by George Routledge and Sons. Read the full text here.
Author: Alexandre Dumas

Title: This Promise of Change
Subtitle: One Girl’s Story in the Fight for School Equality
Description: In this autobiographical work, Jo Ann Allen Boyce recounts her experience of being one of the first Black children to integrate a public high school in Clinton, Tennessee, following desegregation in the late 1950s.
Author: Jo Ann Allen Boyce

Title: October Sky
Description: Originally published under the title Rocket Boys, this memoir recounts the story of six rocket-obsessed friends growing up in a small West Virginia mining town in the 1950s.
Author: Homer Hickam

Title: A Mango-Shaped Space
Description: In this novel, a thirteen-year-old girl learns to understand and manage her synesthesia, a neurological condition in which one sense involuntarily triggers responses from other senses.
Author: Wendy Mass

Title: They Call Me Güero
Subtitle: A Border Kid's Poems
Description: This verse novel chronicles the daily life of a Mexican-American twelve-year-old.
Author: David Bowles

Title: The Impossible Knife of Memory
Description: After years of instability, Hayley and her father, Andy, return to Andy's hometown to make a fresh start. But Andy's PTSD from the Iraq War and Hayley's own traumatic memories threaten their ability to rebuild their lives.
Author: Laurie Halse Anderson

Title: Home Is Not a Country
Description: In this novel in verse, a teen struggles with feelings of disconnection from both her family's homeland and her suburban American life.
Author: Safia Elhillo

Title: Literary Terms
Subtitle: Master the Language of Literature
Description: Whether you're preparing for a standardized test, taking an English course, or just hoping to better understand your favorite poem, our collection of literary terms will teach you the language you need to read and analyze literature of all kinds.

Title: American Street
Description: In Ibi Zoboi's debut novel, a young Haitian immigrant tries to make a new life for herself in Detroit.
Author: Ibi Zoboi

Title: Homecoming
Subtitle: The Tillerman Cycle, Book 1
Description: After they are abandoned by their mother, the four Tillerman children undertake a difficult journey to find a new home.
Author: Cynthia Voigt

Title: There Goes the Neighborhood
Description: When her Los Angeles neighborhood starts developing and reducing the amount of affordable housing, fifteen-year-old Rhea leads her friends in creating fake news about gang activity in order to scare away invasive investors.
Author: Jade Adia

Title: Too Bright to See
Description: During one eventful summer, Bug grapples with grief, change, and identity while investigating a ghostly presence.
Author: Kyle Lukoff

Title: A Walk in the Woods
Subtitle: Rediscovering America on the Appalachian Trail
Description: With his characteristic wit, Bill Bryson recounts his five-month hike along the Appalachian Trail.
Author: Bill Bryson

Title: The Boy Who Invented TV
Subtitle: The Story of Philo Farnsworth
Description: This biography recounts the work of Philo Farnsworth, the first person to transmit a television image.
Author: Kathleen Krull

Title: Essential Academic Vocabulary for Middle School Students
Description: Whether you're hoping to improve your comprehension of reading assignments or simply looking to increase your word knowledge, our lists of essential, high-frequency words will put you on the path to vocabulary success.

Subtitle: New Revelations of the Americas Before Columbus
Description: This nonfiction book presents research about the indigenous peoples of the Western Hemisphere before the arrival of Europeans in 1492, shedding new light on the knowledge that these groups had in the fields of science, engineering, medicine, agriculture, and more.
Author: Charles C. Mann

Title: Eight Cousins
Description: After her parents' death, Rose tries to find a home with various relatives, including her wealthy aunts, her eccentric uncle, and her many cousins.
Author: Louisa May Alcott

Title: All the Light We Cannot See
Description: Marie-Laure is a blind French girl who flees the Nazi occupation of Paris. Werner Pfennig is a young orphan living in a German mining town. In this Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, their lives intertwine in unexpected ways as they try to survive the havoc of war.
Author: Anthony Doerr

Title: Becoming Muhammad Ali
Description: This fictionalized biography, written in a combination of prose and verse, imagines the early life of Cassius Clay, better known as Muhammad Ali.
Author: Kwame Alexander

Description: Published in 1949, this dystopian classic imagines a future of perpetual war, militaristic propaganda, and total government surveillance.
Author: George Orwell

Title: Born Behind Bars
Description: After spending the first nine years of his life in prison with his mother, Kabir learns to survive on the streets of Chennai, India, while looking for a way to prove his mother's innocence.
Author: Padma Venkatraman

Title: What I Carry
Description: After bouncing from foster home to foster home, seventeen-year-old Muir moves in with a family that challenges her fiercely guarded independence.
Author: Jennifer Longo

Title: Invisible Inkling
Description: This first book in the series introduces Hank Wolowitz, a fourth grader in New York, who has an invisible furry bandapat giving him advice on how to deal with a bully.
Author: Emily Jenkins

Title: The Crossover
Description: Twin brothers Josh and Jordan Bell clash both on and off the basketball court. How high can you score on this list of words from Alexander's award-winning novel in verse?
Author: Kwame Alexander

Title: King and the Dragonflies
Description: King tries to help his best friend escape a troubled home while coping with the death of his brother.
Author: Kacen Callender

Title: Power Suffixes
Subtitle: Flex Your Vocab Muscles with These Essential Word Endings
Description: Hoping to punch up your vocabulary? Knock out even the most challenging words with our collection of common English suffixes.

Title: Ground Zero
Subtitle: A Novel of 9/11
Description: A teen in New York City fights for his life during the September 11, 2001 attack on the World Trade Center, while on September 11, 2019, a teen in Afghanistan gets caught up in war.
Author: Alan Gratz

Title: Jazz
Description: Set during the Harlem Renaissance, this follow-up to the Pulitzer Prize-winning Beloved explores a love triangle that ends violently.
Author: Toni Morrison

Title: Everlost
Description: After a deadly car crash, fourteen-year-olds Nick and Allie try to find their purpose as they wander around Everlost, a magical world halfway between life and death.
Author: Neal Shusterman

Title: The Rock and the River
Description: Growing up in Chicago in the 1960s, Sam is a witness to both racism and the growing Civil Rights Movement. But when his father and brother embrace conflicting tactics for confronting prejudice and violence in their community, Sam must figure out where his loyalties lie.
Author: Kekla Magoon

Title: Merci Suárez Changes Gears
Description: For Merci Suárez, sixth grade is a year of change. A scholarship student at the posh Seaward Pines Academy, Merci must juggle extra community service and family responsibilities, all while coping with a nasty classmate and her beloved grandfather's declining health.
Author: Meg Medina

Title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
Description: In the fourth book of the Harry Potter series, the Triwizard Tournament brings foreign students — and unexpected dangers — to Hogwarts.
Author: J.K. Rowling

Title: The Cruel Prince
Description: Seventeen-year-old Jude, who was kidnapped by a faerie soldier when she was a child, fights for a position of power in the faerie kingdom. This is the first book in the Folk of the Air trilogy.
Author: Holly Black

Title: Al Capone Does My Shirts
Description: In 1935, twelve-year-old Moose moves to Alcatraz Island with his parents and his autistic sister Natalie. With a little help from his new friend Piper, Moose learns to adapt to life at the notorious prison.
Author: Gennifer Choldenko

Title: Paper Towns
Description: When his old friend (and crush) Margo disappears, Quentin tries to find out what happened to her by following the clues she left behind.
Author: John Green

Title: Punching Bag
Description: In this sequel to Free Lunch, the author recounts how, as a teenager in Texas, he struggled to protect himself and his younger brother from the angry outbursts of their parents.
Author: Rex Ogle

Title: Commonly Confused Words, Grades 11–12
Description: Commonly confused words are pairs or groups of words that share similar spellings or pronunciations but have different meanings or usages. This collection features commonly confused words that eleventh- and twelfth-grade students frequently encounter while reading or taking standardized tests.

Title: The Stars Beneath Our Feet
Description: In this novel, a 12-year-old boy uses his passion for building to come to terms with his brother's death.
Author: David Barclay Moore

Title: The Devil's Arithmetic
Description: During a Passover Seder, 12-year-old Hannah is mysteriously transported from 1980s New York to Poland during World War II. When Hannah is forced into a concentration camp, her survival depends on understanding the depraved arithmetic the Nazis use to keep track of their prisoners.
Author: Jane Yolen

Title: One Crazy Summer
Description: In the summer of 1968, three sisters travel to California to visit their estranged mother. While there, they learn about the fight for equality and civil rights.
Author: Rita Williams-Garcia

Title: The Importance of Being Earnest
Description: Jack and Algernon — two bachelors in 19th-century England — use false identities to get what they want — and get into trouble — in this comedy by Oscar Wilde. Read the full text here.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Title: The Long Ride
Description: In 1970s New York, seventh-grader Jamila Clarke must take a forty-minute bus ride to a new school as part of an experiment for racial integration.
Author: Marina Budhos

Title: Ordinary Hazards
Subtitle: A Memoir
Description: In this memoir, told in verse, poet Nikki Grimes explores her traumatic childhood and the development of her love of writing.
Author: Nikki Grimes

Title: Walk Two Moons
Description: While trying to track down her missing mother, thirteen-year-old Salamanca entertains her grandparents with strange stories about a girl named Phoebe Winterbottom.
Author: Sharon Creech

Title: Games of Deception
Subtitle: The True Story of the First U.S. Olympic Basketball Team at the 1936 Olympics in Hitler's Germany
Description: This nonfiction account traces the history of basketball through the U.S. team's first Olympic competition, in pre-World War II Germany.
Author: Andrew Maraniss

Title: Power Prefixes
Subtitle: Boost Your Word Knowledge with These Essential Affixes
Description: Our collection of potent prefixes will add to your etymological expertise and help you deduce the meanings of even the most complex words.

Title: Metamorphosis
Description: Gregor Samsa wakes up to find that he has transformed into a monstrous insect. Learn these words from Kafka's exploration of alienation, and conformity. Read the full text, translated by Ian Johnston, here.
Author: Franz Kafka

Title: Forget Me Not
Description: Waking up from a two-week coma, eighteen-year-old Stevie Green has trouble remembering events and people from the past two years of her life in a small town in Pennsylvania.
Author: Alyson Derrick

Title: The Golden Goblet
Description: An orphan living in ancient Egypt, twelve-year-old Ranofer dreams of becoming a master goldsmith — but instead he must work at menial jobs for his cruel half-brother. When Ranofer discovers a stolen goblet in his brother's possession, he believes he may have a chance at a new life.
Author: Eloise Jarvis McGraw

Title: Eleanor & Park
Description: Rainbow Rowell's best-selling novel chronicles an unlikely love story between two teens struggling to fit in.
Author: Rainbow Rowell

Title: Violets Are Blue
Description: Following her parents' divorce, twelve-year-old Wren uses her interest in special effects makeup to make friends at a new school while overcoming struggles with her mother at home.
Author: Barbara Dee

Title: Art Attack: The Vocabulary of Creativity
Subtitle: Essential Words from the Art World
Description: Whether it’s dance or drama, painting or poetry, each form of art has a unique lexicon that helps us describe and understand it. Whether you’re an aspiring poet, a virtuoso musician, a theater geek, or just a fan, this collection has all the words you’ll need to explain, admire, and critique the visual and performing arts.

Title: Any Day with You
Description: Kaia spends her summer making a movie influenced by Filipino folklore, while trying to convince her beloved grandfather not to return to the Philippines.
Author: Mae Respicio

Title: On the Come Up
Description: Bri aspires to be a rapper — but to make her dreams come true, she'll need to overcome family hardships, prejudice at school, and misconceptions about her art.
Author: Angie Thomas

Title: Moon Over Manifest
Description: During the Great Depression, Abilene Tucker tries to solve a mystery in her father's hometown of Manifest, Kansas, while also learning about Manifest's fascinating past.
Author: Clare Vanderpool

Title: Three Little Words
Subtitle: A Memoir
Description: When her mother could not care for her, Ashley Rhodes-Courter moved between fourteen different foster homes over nine years. In this memoir, she retraces her heartbreaking journey.
Author: Ashley Rhodes-Courter

Title: Accountable
Subtitle: The True Story of a Racist Social Media Account and the Teenagers Whose Lives It Changed
Description: Focusing on how a high school student's Instagram account shattered a small town in California, the author explores how much responsibility our society should have in preventing the spread of hateful ideas.
Author: Dashka Slater

Title: The Witch Boy
Description: Aster is forbidden from learning magic because he is a boy, but when a sinister creature threatens his world, performing magic may be the only way he can save his family and friends. Learn these words from the bewitching graphic novel by Molly Knox Ostertag.
Author: Molly Knox Ostertag

Title: The Circuit
Description: This collection of autobiographical short stories by Francisco Jiménez explores the immigrant experience in the United States.
Author: Francisco Jiménez

Title: The Weight of Blood
Description: In the small town of Springville, Georgia, the struggle to hide family secrets comes to a bloody end in Madison Washington's senior year of high school.
Author: Tiffany D. Jackson

Title: A Night to Remember
Description: In this non-fiction book, Walter Lord provides a detailed account of the Titanic's fatal collision with an iceberg and the behavior of the passengers and crew in the aftermath.
Author: Walter Lord

Title: Creative Writing: High School
Description: If you need inspiration for your next story or poem, be sure to review this list of words related to creative writing. We won't keep you in suspense: you'll learn all about plot, characterization, dialogue, and more.

Title: Ripped from the Headlines: September 2022
Subtitle: Our Weekly Roundups of Current Events Vocabulary
Description: Each week, we peruse the news to give you a word’s-eye view of what’s happening in the world. Here are some of our favorite examples from current events and culture stories. Whether you’re a news nerd, a word nerd, or you just like learning, these lists are a fun way to wrap up your week.

Title: And Then There Were None
Description: Investigate these words from Agatha Christie's masterpiece to figure out why it's the world's best-selling mystery novel.
Author: Agatha Christie

Title: The Handmaid's Tale
Description: In this dystopian novel, America is a totalitarian theocracy in which young women are conscripted to serve the political elite.
Author: Margaret Atwood

Title: Winesburg, Ohio
Subtitle: A Group of Tales of Ohio Small-Town Life
Description: This collection of interlinked short stories centers around protagonist George Willard and the inhabitants of his hometown.
Author: Sherwood Anderson

Title: No Summit out of Sight
Subtitle: The True Story of the Youngest Person to Climb the Seven Summits
Description: This memoir recounts the incredible journey of Jordan Romero — the youngest person to climb the world's tallest mountains of every continent.
Author: Jordan Romero

Title: The Moonlit Vine
Description: Fourteen-year-old Taína (Ty) Perez is overwhelmed by troubles within her family, school, and gang-filled neighborhood, when her dying Puerto Rican grandmother passes down sacred objects that had belonged to their ancestral Taíno leader and warrior.
Author: Elizabeth Santiago

Title: You Don't Know Everything, Jilly P!
Description: After discovering that her little sister was born Deaf, twelve-year-old Jilly learns that life doesn't always work the same way for everyone.
Author: Alex Gino
